✨A Message from our Superintendent✨

Hello Parents/Guardians and Staff,

I would like to take a moment to clarify the purpose of the ThoughtExchange.

ThoughtExchange is not a vote.

SRVUSD is planning to enhance remote learning AND we are planning for a return to in-person instruction as soon as it is safe to do so.

Remote learning will remain available to families and in-person learning will be made available to families when we can.

ThoughtExchange is meant to allow everyone to share their perspectives so that we can strengthen remote learning and prepare for in-person learning.

We will be asking parents to decide whether their child/children will remain in remote learning or return to in-person learning after the September 15th Board meeting.

I hope this clarification will assist families who have been asking further questions or commenting on social media.

Take care,
John

Great News! Congratulations:
🎈🎈Courtney Konopacky 🎈🎈
and
🎉🎉Sarah Clancy 🎉🎉

BOTH SRVUSD Teachers of the Year have been selected as Contra Costa County Teachers of the Year and are going on to represent the county in the California State Teacher of the Year Program!

Courtney and Sarah were selected from a group of 22 outstanding teachers from school districts throughout Contra Costa County.

Our incoming Superintendent, Dr. John Malloy, had this to say:
“I am proud to be joining a school district where the high quality of instruction creates an environment in which students of all abilities have an opportunity to succeed. Educators like Courtney and Sarah set the standard to which we all aspire. The learner-centered environments that they have created represent the best of education, not only in California, but beyond, and I congratulate them on this honor.”

Well done Courtney and Sarah! We are rooting for you! 👏👏👏👏

SRVUSD Student Anushree Banerjee Wins Design Contest for new California Mental Health Awareness License Plate

Anushree is a student at Dougherty Valley High School. She designed the winning entry for California’s Mental Health Awareness License Plate after participating in a statewide contest for high school students.

Proceeds raised from the sale of the plates will go to the California Department of Education for Mental Health Wellness Centers in California’s schools.

Dougherty Valley High School is one of two SRVUSD comprehensive high schools that is scheduled to open a Wellness Center on their campus in the 2020-21 school year. The Wellness Center is designed to be a place where students can go during the school day to speak with a caring adult when they feel pressure, stress or anxiety or they just need to take a break.

Congratulations to Anshuree!

Retiree Recognition👏

Last night, the Board of Education held a virtual recognition ceremony honoring and thanking all SRVUSD employees who will be retiring this year. This annual event recognized the contributions of 54 employees whose combined total years of service to the SRVUSD totalled more than 1,030 years!

As a token of gratitude to the retirees for their many years of service to our students and community, each one will be receiving a clock, engraved with their name and years of service.

It's time for these dedicated individuals to check items off their bucket list, travel, enjoy their families, friends and more. Regardless of the capacity in which these individuals served, their work had a positive impact on the lives of countless children and families. We thank them!

You can view a list of all the retirees on our website: https://tinyurl.com/SRVUSD2020Retirees
